qas.question: Madonna and Maverick sued which company for poor bookkeeping and mismanagement of resources?
Warner filed a countersuit stating that who lost 10 of millions of dollars on its own?
Warner resolved the dispute by buying whose shares?
Maverick became a wholly owned  subsidiary of which company?

context: The next year Madonna and Maverick sued <a0_0>Warner Music Group<a0_0/> and its former parent company Time Warner, claiming that mismanagement of resources and poor bookkeeping had cost the company millions of dollars. In return, Warner filed a countersuit alleging that <a1_0>Maverick<a1_0/> had lost tens of millions of dollars on its own. The dispute was resolved when the Maverick shares, owned by <a2_0>Madonna and Ronnie Dashev<a2_0/>, were purchased by Warner. Madonna and Dashev's company became a wholly owned subsidiary of <a3_0>Warner Music<a3_0/>, but Madonna was still signed to Warner under a separate recording contract.
